lines.gurmukhi: Awvq hY jw kY BIK mwgin iBKwrI dIn dyKq ADInih inrwso n ibfwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aavat Hai Jaa Kai Bheekh Maagani Bhikhaaree Deena , Daykhat Adheenahi Niraaso N Bidaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whosoever is visited by a beggar for alms, impressed by his humility, the donor never turns him away disappointed.

lines.gurmukhi: bYTq hY jw kY duAwr Awsw kY ibfwr s√çwn AMq krunw kY qoir tUik qwih fwir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Baitthat Hai Jaa Kai Duaar Aasaa Kai Bidaar Svaana , Ant Karounaa Kai Tori Tooki Taahi Daari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whosoever has a dog coming to his door after discarding all other alternatives, the master of the house out of clemency serves him with a morsel of food.

lines.gurmukhi: pwien kI pnhI rhq prhrI prI qwhU kwhU kwij auiT clq smwir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Paain Kee Panahee Rahat Paraharee Paree , Taahoo Kaahoo Kaaji Outthi Chalat Samaari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A shoe keeps lying unattended and uncared, but when its owner has to go out on some work, he too takes care of it then and uses it.

lines.gurmukhi: Cwif AhMkwr Cwr hoie gur mwrg mY kbhU kY dieAw kY dieAwl pig Dwir hY ]434]
lines.transliteration_english: Chhaadi Ahankaar Chhaar Hoi Gur Maarag Mai , Kabahoo Kai Daiaa Kai Daiaal Pagi Dhaari Hai ?434?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, he who ever discards his ego and pride and lives in the refuge of the True Guru in utter humility like the dust of His feet, the clement True Guru will definitely shower His benevolence one day and attach him with His feet (He blesses him with
